com.clarionmedia.infinitum.context.impl
Class XmlApplicationContext

java.lang.Object
  com.clarionmedia.infinitum.context.AbstractContext
      com.clarionmedia.infinitum.context.impl.XmlApplicationContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
InfinitumContext
public class XmlApplicationContext
extends AbstractContext

Implementation of InfinitumContext. This should not be instantiated directly but rather obtained through the XmlContextFactory, which creates an instance of this from infinitum.cfg.xml.

Since:
06/26/12
Version:
1.0 06/26/12
Author:
Tyler Treat

Method Detail

isDebug

public boolean isDebug()
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Indicates if debug is enabled or not. If it is enabled, Infinitum will produce log statements in Logcat, otherwise it will not produce any logging. This value is also used by Infinitum's logging framework.

Returns:
true if debug is on, false if not

setDebug

public void setDebug(boolean debug)
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Sets the debug value indicating if logging is enabled or not. If it is enabled, Infinitum will produce log statements in Logcat, otherwise it will not produce any logging. This should be set to false in a production environment. The debug value can be enabled in infinitum.cfg.xml with <property name="debug">true</property> and disabled with <property name="debug">false</property>.

Parameters:
debug - true if debug is to be enabled, false if it's to be disabled

getConfigurationMode

public InfinitumContext.ConfigurationMode getConfigurationMode()
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Returns the InfinitumContext.ConfigurationMode value of this InfinitumContext, indicating which style of configuration this application is using, XML- or annotation-based. An XML configuration means that domain model mappings are provided through XML mapping files, while an annotation configuration means that mappings and other properties are provided in source code using Java annotations.

Returns:
ConfigurationMode for this application

setConfigurationMode

public void setConfigurationMode(InfinitumContext.ConfigurationMode mode)
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Sets the InfinitumContext.ConfigurationMode value for this InfinitumContext. The mode can be set in infinitum.cfg.xml with <property name="mode">xml</property> or <property name="mode">annotations</property> in the application element. An XML configuration means that domain model mappings are provided through XML mapping files, while an annotation configuration means that mappings and other properties are provided in source code using Java annotations. If annotations are used, all domain model classes must be stored in the same package. If a mode property is not provided in infinitum.cfg.xml, annotations will be used by default.

Parameters:
mode - the ConfigurationMode

hasSqliteDb

public boolean hasSqliteDb()
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Returns true if there is a SQLite database configured or false if not. If infinitum.cfg.xml is missing the sqlite element, this will be false.

Returns:
true if a SQLite database is configured or false if not

getSqliteDbName

public java.lang.String getSqliteDbName()
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Returns the name of the SQLite database for this InfinitumContext . This is the name used to construct the database and subsequently open it.

Returns:
the name of the SQLite database for this InfinitumContext

setSqliteDbName

public void setSqliteDbName(java.lang.String dbName)
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Sets the value of the SQLite database name for this InfinitumContext. The SQLite database name can be specified in infinitum.cfg.xml with <property name="dbName">MyDB</property> in the sqlite element.

Parameters:
dbName - the name of the SQLite database

getSqliteDbVersion

public int getSqliteDbVersion()
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Returns the version number of the SQLite database for this InfinitumContext.

Returns:
the SQLite database version number

setSqliteDbVersion

public void setSqliteDbVersion(int version)
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Sets the version for the SQLite database for this InfinitumContext. The SQLite database version can be specified in infinitum.cfg.xml with <property name="dbVersion">2</property> in the sqlite element.

Parameters:
version - the version to set for the SQLite database

getDomainTypes

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getDomainTypes()
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Returns a List of all fully-qualified domain model classes registered with this InfinitumContext. Domain types are defined as being persistent entities.

Returns:
a List of all registered domain model classes

addDomainModel

public void addDomainModel(java.lang.String domainModel)
Description copied from interface: InfinitumContext
Adds the specified domain model class to the entire collection of domain models registered with this InfinitumContext. Domain models are defined in infinitum.cfg.xml using <model resource="com.foo.domain.MyModel" /> in the domain element.
